title: Rory cruises past Spaun in playoff to win Players
content: Rory McIlroy won the Players Championship in a Monday finish over J.J. Spaun that featured three dynamic playoff holes at the TPC Sawgrass, a harsh wind and very little drama.

title: WVU snub 'robbery' at highest level, gov. says
content: West Virginia Gov. Patrick Morrisey wants his attorney general to investigate and work closely with the NCAA to ensure the men's tournament selection process is transparent and fair.

title: S. Alabama has NIT invite nixed: 'Unacceptable'
content: South Alabama had their invitation to the NIT rescinded after the team was informed they would be playing, a decision their coach called "unacceptable."

title: Mavs send Davis to G League to prep for return
content: Anthony Davis, who hasn't played for the Mavericks since suffering a strained left adductor on Feb. 8, will practice and scrimmage with the G League's Texas Legends.

title: Sources: Texans' Stingley gets record deal for DB
content: Derek Stingley has agreed to a three-year, $90 million extension with the Texans that makes him the highest-paid defensive back in NFL history, sources told ESPN.

title: Duke stays No. 1 in men's AP Top 25; Auburn at 4
content: While the NCAA tournament tabbed Auburn as its overall No. 1 seed, it was Duke that topped the AP Top 25 ahead of Houston, Florida and then the Tigers at No. 4.

title: Braves' Strider K's 6 of 8 batters in spring debut
content: Braves ace Spencer Strider returned to the mound Monday for the first time in almost a calendar year and threw 2⅔ perfect innings.

title: It's bracket time: Make your picks for the men's tournament
content: The bracket is set. Here's everything you need to know about the competitors for this year's national title.

title: Your guide to all 68 teams in the men’s NCAA tournament
content: The bracket is set, here's everything you need to know about the competitors for this year's national title.

title: 'I feel like I'm a more complete player': Players win a sign of what's to come for Rory in 2025?
content: After two early wins in signature events, McIlroy's game is in a great place with the Masters and the rest of the majors in the not-too-distant future.

title: You've signed a one-of-a-kind freshman in Cooper Flagg. Now what? Here's how Duke built a contender around its prized recruit
content: In an era when teams are incentivized to build around experience, the Blue Devils built a contender with youth.

title: How a 64-team college football tournament would play out
content: What if the CFP went as deep as March Madness? We picked our college football bracket and played out the first two rounds.

title: MLB's villains or its gold standard? How the Los Angeles Dodgers got here
content: Love them or loathe them, the defending champs built a new evil empire with a series of monumental moves.

title: Newcastle's Carabao Cup glory, Barcelona's epic comeback, boring Arsenal-Chelsea, more
content: From Newcastle ending their nearly six-decade trophy drought to Barcelona's comeback for the ages at Atletico Madrid, it was another brilliant weekend across Europe. Gab Marcotti has what you need to know.

title: Monterrey's Sergio Ramos gets 30th career red
content: Sergio Ramos was sent off in the final minutes of Monterrey's victory over UNAM on Sunday, his first dismissal since he moved to Liga MX.

title: Fernandes on Keane criticism: It motivates me
content: Manchester United's Bruno Fernandes said he has plenty of respect for Roy Keane but he wants to do things in his own way.

title: Antonio vows to return to football after car crash
content: West Ham United forward Michail Antonio has insisted he will play professional football again after he recovers from being involved in a near-fatal road traffic collision in December.

title: Sources: Casadó (knee) to miss rest of season
content: Marc Casadó is likely to miss the rest of the season after injuring knee ligaments in Sunday's 4-2 win over Atlético Madrid, sources have told ESPN.

title: Messi back in starting lineup, scores in Miami win
content: Substitute Fafà Picault scored for Inter Miami CF in the 89th minute, and Lionel Messi scored for the first time this MLS regular season in a dramatic, late 2-1 victory at Atlanta United FC on Sunday.

title: Slot: 'Hunger' not the issue in Liverpool cup loss
content: Liverpool head coach Arne Slot dismissed the idea Newcastle United's players were "hungrier" in Sunday's Carabao Cup final, but admitted Eddie Howe's side were deserved winners.

title: Source: Pulisic in talks over new AC Milan deal
content: United States national team star Christian Pulisic is in negotiations with AC Milan over a new contract, a source has told ESPN.

title: City's Gonzalez echoes Pep: All games now finals
content: Manchester City have got "nine finals" left in the Premier League to make sure they qualify for next season's Champions League, midfielder Nico Gonzalez has said.

title: What would it take for Wrexham to reach Premier League from League 1?
content: Wrexham's rise from nonleague has truly been the stuff of Hollywood legend -- no surprise given their owners. But can they now actually get to the Premier League from here?

title: NHL playoff watch: The Bruins' path to the postseason
content: It's a long shot, but the B's can still pull this off -- here's how. Plus, full playoff projections, draft lottery standings, more.

title: WNBA trade grades: Did the defending champion Liberty get even better in trade for Cloud?
content: Natasha Cloud gives New York another skilled distributor and a stronger defense, while Connecticut gains two first-round picks to help its rebuild.

title: Men's first-round betting odds, lines, spread and BPI
content: Every set of betting lines, spreads, totals and more betting odds for the first round of the 2025 men's NCAA tournament.

title: Men's guide to team mascots, school colors and famous alumni
content: We've collected the basic information on all 68 schools in this year's NCAA men's basketball tournament so you can develop a rooting interest.

title: Hamilton gets the full Ferrari experience during his debut in red
content: Odd strategy calls, awkward radio exchanges, Lewis Hamilton's Ferrari debut was full of meme-able moments that have haunted the team in recent years.

title: Ronald Acuna Jr. says he'll be more careful this season -- but no one believes him
content: From 40/70 to 40/30? The Braves' 2023 NL MVP is rehabbing with a plan to be stronger -- and healthier.

title: Six March Madness stars to watch
content: Eric Moody breaks down which players fantasy managers should keep an eye on during the 2025 Women's NCAA tournament.

title: MLS Power Rankings: Vancouver overtakes Miami for top spot
content: Miami won on Sunday night, but it wasn't enough to keep it on top of ESPN's Power Rankings, as Vancouver continued its run as MLS' only perfect team.

title: Transfer rumors, news: Arsenal, Chelsea keeping tabs on Thuram
content: Chelsea and Arsenal have joined the race for Inter Milan star Marcus Thuram. Transfer Talk has the latest news, gossip and rumors.

title: Why Geovany Quenda can be Chelsea's answer to Saka
content: Chelsea look set to land the Sporting CP teen in 2026 and Quenda's style has been compared to an Arsenal star.

title: Pandemonium in Karnataka Assembly over Chief Minister’s remarks on RSS
content: Trouble began when the Chief Minister, while brushing aside the Opposition’s allegations that the law and order situation had collapsed, made certain remarks against the RSS and its role with respect to law and order

title: Railways out of financial stress of pandemic years: Ashwini Vaishnaw
content: Lok Sabha begins discussion on Railways’ demands for grants, Opposition questions delay in appointments

title: Nagpur violent clash LIVE updates: Violence erupts during Bajrang Dal, VHP protest for removal of Aurangzeb’s tomb
content: According to police, tension escalated when the rumour of burning the holy book of the Muslim community during the protest spread in Ganeshpeth, Mahal, and Gandhibagh areas of the city.

title: Violence erupts in Nagpur during Bajrang Dal, VHP protest for removal of Aurangzeb’s tomb
content: Violent protests erupt in Nagpur over Aurangzeb’s tomb demolition demand, leading to tension and clashes between communities

title: Clash Erupts In Nagpur Amid Aurangzeb Tomb Row, D Fadnavis Appeals For Calm
content: Chief Minister Devendra Fadnavis has appealed for peace after violence broke out in Nagpur amid the row over the call for removal of Mughal emperor Aurangzeb's tomb.

title: PM Modi, Tulsi Gabbard Meet Hours After India Flags Khalistani Terror To US
content: Prime Minister Narendra Modi met Tulsi Gabbard, the United States' Director of National Intelligence, who is in India for a two-and-a-half day visit, in Delhi Monday evening.

title: "Ballet Dance Between Dragon, Elephant": China Reacts To PM's Comments
content: The mutual respect between New Delhi and Beijing is openly on display. The latest being Prime Minister Narendra Modi's "positive" remarks on the ties between the two countries, which China has "appreciated".

title: How An Anonymous Letter Exposed UP Teacher's Abuse Of Students
content: Police in Uttar Pradesh's Hathras are looking for the suspended Chief Proctor of a college, who faces serious allegations of sexually abusing students and recording the acts to blackmail them.

title: US Intelligence Chief's 'Islamic Caliphate' Remark On Crisis In Bangladesh
content: The United States is deeply concerned about the situation in Bangladesh, US Intelligence chief Tulsi Gabbard told NDTV World today, speaking about the persecution of religious minorities.

title: Biden Faces Uncertainty As Trump Declares Presidential Pardons "Null, Void"
content: Former US President Joe Biden faces uncertainty after his successor Donald Trump has declared that Biden's last-minute presidential pardons, including one to his son Hunter Biden, are "null and void".

title: PM Modi Joins Truth Social, Alt-Tech Social Media Platform Owned By Trump
content: Prime Minister Narendra Modi on Monday joined Truth Social, a social media platform owned by US President Donald Trump.

title: Video Shows Indian-Origin Student At Bar With Senior Before She Went Missing
content: Missing Indian-American student Sudiksha Konanki and Joshua Riibe, the person of interest in the case, were seen together at an outdoor bar before she vanished from a Dominican Republic beach on March 6.

title: NZ Prime Minister's 'Champions Trophy' Remark Leaves PM Modi Amused - Video
content: Prime Minister Narendra Modi was left amused by his New Zealand counterpart Christopher Luxon's hilarious comment on the Champions Trophy 2025 final during their meeting.

title: PCB Suffers Rs 869 Crore Loss In Champions Trophy, Takes Drastic Measures
content: The PCB has reportedly suffered an 85 percent loss on their investment in the ICC Champions Trophy 2025.

title: 6-Year-Old Among 3 Of Family From Telangana Die In Road Accident In US
content: A woman software professional and her six-year-old son were among three members of a family from Telangana who died in a road accident in Florida in the US, their relative said here on Monday.

title: "BCCI Trying To...": Brook's Teammate Drops Blunt Verdict On 2-Year IPL Ban
content: England star Harry Brook pulled out of IPL 2025 season just days before the opening match. As a result of the decision, he will be banned from participating in the T20 league for 2 years.

title: Minister Shares Video Of India's Hyperloop Tube, Set To Be "World's Longest"
content: The 410-meter-long Hyperloop test tube located at IIT Chennai is already the longest Hyperloop test facility in Asia.

title: Vadodara Crash Accused Swapped Seats With Friend: What New Footage Shows
content: Rakshit Chaurasia, the accused in the Vadodara crash that left a woman dead and seven others injured, may have insisted that he would drive the car and convinced his friend Pranshu to shift to the seat next to the driver, CCTV footage shows

title: Opinion: Aamir Khan @60: Caught In His Own 'Cage'
content: Aamir Khan, an actor who once took pride in doing things differently, now finds himself pigeonholed in a cage of his own making, bound by the expectations of his fan base.

title: CM pats student for innovative app that detects heart diseases in 7 seconds
content: Naidu encourages the Anantapur boy, now settled in U.S., to pursue further innovations in AI, and assures him of govt. support

title: No one feels safe in Bihar today, says Tejashwi Yadav
content: The Leader of Opposition said Chief Minister Nitish Kumar-led Bihar government has failed to contain law and order situation in the State. As many as 60,000 murders, 25,000 rapes and the highest number of killings of policemen and assaults have taken place in the State during the regime of Mr. Kumar, he said in the assembly.

title: SP MP demands PM Modi’s response on Trump’s ‘grant for voter turnout’ claim
content: The PM has not spoken a word despite the claims of interference of a foreign entity in our election process, Ramji Lal Suman said in the Rajya Sabha, adding that the government’s silence adds to the suspicion.

title: Survey works initiated for dyke wall, surveillance road along Eloor-Edayar stretch of Periyar
content: The survey is a preliminary step toward implementing the project, which is part of the long-term initiatives under the Periyar River Action Plan

title: Viral meningitis: Health department steps up surveillance in Ernakulam
content: The tests revealed the presence of enteroviruses in the samples, which are usually transmitted through contact with secretions from an infected person

title: Delhi HC asks Centre to consider as representation plea to rename India as Bharat
content: Justice Sachin Datta recorded that the petitioner seeks to withdraw the present petition to pursue the matter with the ministries concerned for disposal in terms of the June 3, 2020 order passed by the Supreme Court

title: Workers’ meet to discuss strike against Labour Codes
content: Central Trade Unions said the convention is being held in the background of the Centre’s “stubborn stand” to implement four Labour Codes

title: Opposition criticises Modi in the Rajya Sabha over violence in Manipur
content: Initiating the debate while discussing the Manipur Budget for 2025-26, senior Congress MP Shaktisinh Gohil asked the BJP to act beyond narrow political interests to serve the country; he criticised the PM for not visiting the State following violence

title: India, Australia agree to deepen interoperability across maritime, land and air domains
content: The two countries also decided to focus on cooperation in maritime domain awareness, reciprocal information sharing, industry and science and technology collaboration

title: Tulsi Gabbard Was Asked What Holi Means To Her. Her Response
content: Holi, also known as the festival of colours, was celebrated two days before Tulsi Gabbard, who follows Hindu tradition, arrived in India.

title: Violent clashes erupt in Nagpur: Vehicles torched, cops injured; CM Fadnavis makes appeal
content: Violent clashes erupted in Nagpur's Mahal area, with vandalism and arson reported Monday night. Vehicles were set ablaze and stone pelting caused panic among residents. Police intervened to control the situation, deploying additional personnel. Authorities are investigating the cause, urging locals to maintain peace and cooperate.

title: 'Thank you my friend': PM joins Truth Social after Trump's Fridman post
content: Prime Minister Modi joined Truth Social and quickly interacted with US President Trump, thanking him for sharing his podcast link. Modi discussed a wide array of topics, including his relationship with Trump and ongoing India-US negotiations. Their exchange highlights their mutual admiration and current trade tariff discussions.

title: Is Nitish Kumar preparing for 'son'rise in Bihar?
content: Bihar Chief Minister Nitish Kumar may be preparing his son Nishant Kumar for a political role. Nishant has recently appeared in JD(U) events and posters, hinting at his potential political entry, which could help address concerns about Nitish’s health and the party's future leadership.

title: Talks with Putin today on ending conflict in Ukraine: Donald Trump
content: President Trump plans to discuss ending the Ukraine war with Russian President Putin, focusing on territorial concessions and control of the Zaporizhzhia nuclear power plant. Trump aims to secure a 30-day ceasefire proposal accepted by Ukraine. Russia demands security guarantees excluding Kyiv from Nato membership. Britain's and France's peacekeeping force offer may aid truce enforcement.

title: Elon Musk's ex on hardest part of parenting: I remember being a horror about...
content: Grimes, ex-girlfriend of Elon Musk and mother of his three children, highlights the difficulty of putting kids to bed as the hardest part of parenting. She shares her struggle through a Twitter thread, while also addressing falsely attributed claims about writing on the 'sexuality and kinks' of Fortune 500 CEOs, asserting her lack of control over replicated posts.

title: T'gana CM seeks PM Modi’s appointment over backward classes reservation bills
content: Telangana CM A. Revanth Reddy has requested an appointment with PM Narendra Modi to discuss two bills proposing 42% reservation for backward classes in education, employment, and local bodies. Reddy seeks support from leaders of various political parties, all of whom backed the proposal in the assembly debate.

title: Religious, not political: Deported doctor on keeping Hezbollah leaders' photos on phone
content: Alawieh has been in the US since 2018 when she came on a student visa. As Alawieh arrived at the Boston airport Thursday, she was denied entry as CBP officers started questioning her, searching her phone. Alawieh was asked about the photos and videos of Nasrallah and other Hezbollah leaders. She said she's apolitical and she received those photos on WhatsApp groups.

title: Google CEO Sundar Pichai gives ‘special thanks’ to Elon Musk’s SpaceX for …
content: Google CEO Sundar Pichai thanked SpaceX for launching the first FireSat satellite, part of an AI-powered constellation to detect wildfires. The satellite aims to identify fires as small as 5x5 meters using AI. The project involves partners like Earth Fire Alliance, Moore Foundation, and Muon Space, following Google's $13 million investment for enhancing global fire tracking.

title: How to deal with Trump: Flattery, retaliation, or holding out?
content: President Trump's tariffs on steel and aluminum have prompted varied global reactions, from Canada's forceful retaliation to Mexico's quiet diplomacy. The EU, China, and the UK are adopting differing strategies, causing economic uncertainty and diplomatic tensions. These responses highlight a reshaping of alliances and economic dependencies, with significant implications for global trade and security.

title: 'He has got everything': Kohli backs Patidar to lead RCB for years
content: Star batter Virat Kohli has expressed his strong support for Rajat Patidar, the newly-appointed captain of Royal Challengers Bengaluru (RCB). Kohli believes Patidar is the future leader of the franchise and is confident in his ability to lead the team forward. Patidar succeeds Faf du Plessis and aims to live up to the high expectations.

title: Air Canada responds after Israel replaced by 'Palestinian territories' on flight maps
content: Air Canada apologized after its in-flight maps replaced Israel with 'Palestinian territories.' The maps on 40 Boeing 737 MAX aircraft were deactivated, and Thales acknowledged the error. A rectified map will be installed starting March 14. Similar incidents have occurred with JetBlue, British Airways, and Swiss Airlines. Thales blamed a third-party provider.

title: Gold at record high! Check 5 charts before putting money in gold
content: Gold continues to be a safe haven and wealth generator, with 17% three-year returns surpassing Sensex's 11.6%. With concerns about potential overvaluation and market instability, experts recommend cautious allocation within diversified portfolios.

title: Nasa reschedules Earth return for Sunita Williams and crew—here’s why
content: NASA has confirmed that astronauts Sunita Williams and Butch Wilmore will return to Earth a day earlier than planned due to improved weather conditions. The astronauts, stranded on the ISS for over nine months, will be brought back aboard a SpaceX Crew Dragon capsule, with a splashdown scheduled for March 18.

title: PM Modi joins Trump’s Truth Social, thanks U.S. President for posting interview
content: In a personal outreach, Prime Minister Narendra Modi joined Truth Social, a social media platform whose parent company is majority-owned by U.S. President Donald Trump

title: Ganja seizure: Kalamassery govt. polytechnic college to introduce stringent conditions for hostel room allotment
content: The move comes in the wake of the seizure of nearly 2 kilograms of ganja, allegedly hoarded to spice up Holi celebrations, from two hostel rooms during an overnight raid that lasted until the early hours of March 14

title: A.P.’s ASR district to get second nursing institute
content: It will come up at Addateegala with an annual intake of 60 students for General Nursing Midwifery course

title: Notice to Air India over woman’s brain injury
content: The senior citizen’s family alleged delay in providing wheelchair; DGCA to hold a meeting with airlines

title: Many records destroyed during U.S. invasion of Iraq: Indian Embassy at Baghdad
content: During the war to topple Saddam Hussein, the diplomatic office was evacuated resulting in the records getting lost, says Embassy in reply to RTI query

title: Centre advises reduction in use of cooking oil by 10% in mid-day meals
content: The PM-POSHAN scheme is an opportunity to instil healthy eating habits, encouraging students to prepare and consume fresh, nutritious meals with minimal oil, says the advisory

title: Central amendment to Industrial Disputes Act cannot be relied upon in cases where only State amendment will apply, rules Madras High Court
content: Justice A.D. Maria Clete directs a television company to reinstate a driver in service with continuity in service, backwages and other attendant benefits

title: IPL 2025: KKR Team Preview – SWOT Analysis and Best XI
content: Kolkata Knight Riders aim to secure their fourth IPL title with Ajinkya Rahane as the new captain. Retaining key players like Sunil Narine and Andre Russell, and adding talents such as Quinton de Kock and Anrich Nortje, KKR have a balanced squad. Despite a few weaknesses, their mix of experience and new additions positions them well for a successful season.

title: PM Modi meets US spy chief Tulsi Gabbard, gifts her Kumbh Gangajal
content: Prime Minister Narendra Modi met with US Director of National Intelligence Tulsi Gabbard in New Delhi, discussing enhancing India-US defense and security ties. PM Modi gifted Gangajal, while Gabbard presented tulsi beads. Gabbard also held talks with Rajnath Singh and Ajit Doval on intelligence sharing and security collaboration, strengthening the strategic partnership between the two nations.

title: 'Axar is like a big brother ... Delhi Capitals will win trophy this year'
content: Delhi Capitals have overhauled their team for the upcoming 2025 IPL season with Axar Patel as the new captain. Wicketkeeper Abishek Porel expresses confidence that Patel's leadership will end the franchise's title drought, highlighting his deep understanding of the team and supportive off-field presence. Porel, who was retained by the franchise, highlighted Axar's deep understanding of the team, having spent six years with the Delhi outfit. Axar has been a part of the Delhi Capitals setup since 2019 and has become a crucial player in India's white-ball set-up too.

title: Watch: NZ PM Luxon leaves PM Modi in splits during joint presser
content: New Zealand Prime Minister Christopher Luxon humorously referenced recent cricket outcomes during a joint press conference with Prime Minister Narendra Modi. Luxon acknowledged New Zealand’s losses to India and highlighted the strong sporting ties between the countries. Both leaders welcomed a Memorandum of Cooperation on Sports to bolster collaboration.

title: Lionel Messi to miss World Cup qualifiers against Uruguay and Brazil
content: Lionel Messi will miss Argentina's upcoming World Cup qualifiers against Uruguay and Brazil. Coach Lionel Scaloni announced Messi's exclusion, likely due to a sore left thigh from a recent MLS match. Messi played the full 90 minutes for Inter Miami, but fitness concerns persist. Paulo Dybala, Gonzalo Montiel, and Giovani Lo Celso will also miss these crucial games.

title: Abu Qatal killed — Could 26/11 mastermind Hafiz Saeed be the next target?
content: Lashkar-e-Taiba terrorist Abu Qatal's killing in Pakistan has dealt a significant blow to the group, potentially paving the way for targeting LeT mastermind Hafiz Saeed next. Defence experts stress the need for ongoing counterterrorism measures and suggest that high-level intelligence efforts are closing in on Saeed.

title: 'Ballet of dragon & elephant': China praises PM's remarks on bilateral ties
content: China has praised Prime Minister Narendra Modi's recent comments, emphasizing dialogue and cooperation with India. Beijing noted progress in bilateral ties following Modi's meeting with President Xi Jinping and expressed commitment to maintaining stable and healthy relations, highlighting mutual benefits for global peace and prosperity.

title: 'Unfortunate govt has to protect Aurangzeb's grave': CM Fadnavis
content: Maharashtra CM Devendra Fadnavis stated it is unfortunate that the government must protect Aurangzeb's grave amid calls for its removal. He emphasised adherence to legal procedures due to the site's protected status, ensured by the Archaeological Survey of India. Fadnavis lauded Shivaji Maharaj for his role in securing religious freedom.

title: Pakistan star fined heavily for Level 2 breach after collision with NZ bowler
content: Pakistan cricketer Khushdil Shah has been fined 50% of his match fee for a Level 2 ICC Code of Conduct breach during the first T20I against New Zealand. Khushdil collided with bowler Zakary Foulkes, deemed a careless contact. He accepted the charge, receiving three demerit points. Pakistan struggled, scoring just 91 runs, leading to a nine-wicket loss.

title: Not just Trump: Why crushing 'free speech' is a norm for America
content: ​American exceptionalism is a Will McAvoy speech wrapped in a Big Mac, and nowhere is this more evident than in the country's take on free speech—a delusion that is bipartisan, irrespective of whether one votes red, blue, or purple. Take a recent New Yorker piece titled The Detention of Mahmoud Khalil Is a Flagrant Assault on Free Speech, which, like all others in the same vein, operates under the assumption that Trump isn’t ceteris paribus but a unique, Agent Smith-like bug in the American simulation.

title: 'Did not self-deport ...': Indian-origin student's lawyer refutes US claim
content: ​Srinivasan's attorney Nathan Yaffe said Kristi Noem's post was false and it showed that they were targeting Srinivasan. "Despite doing nothing wrong, Ms Srinivasan booked a flight out of the country to comply with US law, which gave her a 15-day deadline to depart after DHS illegally terminated her student status," Yaffe said.

title: 'Act against Khalistanis in America': India to US spy chief Tulsi Gabbard
content: Rajnath Singh raised concerns about Khalistani extremists operating on American soil in a meeting with US intelligence chief Tulsi Gabbard. They discussed enhancing defence and security ties. The talks also highlighted the activities of the banned Sikh For Justice organization. This meeting follows another between national security advisor Ajit Doval and Gabbard focusing on intelligence sharing.

title: NEET PG 2025 exam to be held on June 15
content: The National Board of Examinations (NBEMS) has confirmed that the NEET PG 2025 exam will be held on June 15, 2025. The exam will be conducted in two shifts: 9:00 AM to 12:30 PM and 3:30 PM to 7:00 PM. The internship completion deadline is set for July 31, 2025. Further details, including the full schedule, will be released soon. Aspirants can check the official NBEMS website for more information.

title: No player indispensable, not even Virat Kohli or Rohit Sharma: Gavaskar
content: Sunil Gavaskar praised India's cricket depth after their 2025 Champions Trophy win despite Jasprit Bumrah's absence. He stressed no player, including Virat Kohli and Rohit Sharma, is indispensable. Highlighting India's resilience and talent pool, Gavaskar noted the team’s strong comeback from a Test defeat to win against England in T20Is and ODIs.

title: Setting up of 1,760 village health clinics in A.P. under way: Health Minister Satya Kumar
content: NDA govt. resuming construction of many PHCs left incomplete by previous YSRCP govt., he says responding to a question in the Andhra Pradesh Assembly

title: Bengaluru-Chennai Expressway to be fully operational by June 2026
content: The Karnataka portion of the expressway was completed and became informally accessible to the public in December 2024

title: Trade talks between India and U.S. ‘positive’, says Commerce Secretary
content: India has proactively engaged with the U.S. to boost trade, says Sunil Barthwal; talks are being held within the framework of ‘Mission 500’ to raise trade between the two countries to $500 billion, say senior officials

title: Head to three new international destinations from KIA this summer
content: Passengers can soon fly to Krabi in Thailand, Hanoi in Vietnam and Hanimaadhoo in Maldives Bengaluru

title: Kerala Sangeetha Nataka Akademi fellowships and awards announced
content: Veena artiste A. Ananthapadmanabhan, playwright and theatre director Xavier Pulppatt, and dancer Kalamandalam Saraswathi get fellowship

title: MLAs demand House Committee probe into ‘corruption’ in cooperative banks
content: MLAs express displeasure at the alleged non-commencement of inquiries, and little or no action taken against the culprits involved in irregularities

title: Kerala HC unhappy over govt. not setting up dedicated authority for Periyar
content: “What we intended was an authority with enough teeth to deal with violations regularly and resolve them, with powers vested in it either statutorily or through executive orders,” says Justice Devan Ramachandran

title: Class X exams: Attendance at 99 per cent in Nellore district on first day
content: Parents of students break the lock of an exam centre room at Zilla Parshad High School in Vavilla village in Kovur Assembly constituency, as it was not opened till 9 a.m.

title: KPCC moves to leverage backward class heft to aid the UDF in local body, Assembly polls
content: KPCC plans to highlight the recent heckling of Tushar Gandhi by RSS workers and the Centre’s decision on seabed mining to woo two backward class communities

title: Jains to take out Bengaluru Chalo today
content: They have taken a strong exception to neglect by the State government towards their demands, including a board or a corporation for their development

title: IPL: Torrent Group acquires majority stake in Gujarat Titans
content: Ahmedabad-based Torrent Group has acquired a 67% controlling stake in IPL franchise Gujarat Titans, previously fully owned by CVC Capital Partners. Despite the transfer, CVC retains a 33% minority stake. Torrent aims to enhance the team's operations and growth. Founded in 2022, the franchise plays at Narendra Modi Stadium and has quickly become successful in the league.

title: WWE Monday Night RAW: Full match, how to watch, and more
content: WWE Monday Night RAW on March 17, 2025, will feature John Cena’s return and face-off with Cody Rhodes in Brussels. Key events include Bron Breakker vs. Finn Bálor for the Intercontinental Championship and a contract signing for the Women's World Championship match at WrestleMania 41.

title: Top 5 entertainment news of the day
content: The entertainment world is abuzz with notable events: Virat Kohli discusses his approach to social media privacy with Anushka Sharma, Shah Rukh Khan may play a villain in Sukumar's next film, Alka Yagnik reacts to being Osama Bin Laden's favorite, Orry and others face legal action for alleged alcohol consumption near Vaishno Devi, and Imran Khan's relationship sparks controversy.

title: 'Modi govt robbing public': Kharge slams Centre over petrol prices
content: Congress President Mallikarjun Kharge criticized PM Modi's government for not reducing fuel prices despite a 34% drop in global crude oil prices since 2014, accusing them of burdening the public and fueling inflation. Union Petroleum Minister Hardeep Singh Puri defended the government's policy, citing the benefits of the recently passed Oilfields Amendment Bill.

title: Gold smuggling case: Actress Ranya Rao’s bail plea adjourned till March 19
content: Kannada actress Ranya Rao's bail plea in a high-profile gold smuggling case has been adjourned to March 19, with the court requiring the DRI’s objections. Arrested on March 3, 2025, with Rs 12.56 crore worth of gold, Ranya is accused of bypassing airport security using her police connections. The case has implicate influential individuals and intensified political controversy.

title: Watch: Footage shows Rakshit Chaurasiya taking driver’s seat before accident
content: Pranshu Chauhan initially drove the car but later switched seats with Rakshit Chaurasiya, who took over the driver's seat. They left from a friend's residence, with Chaurasiya ultimately driving the car that caused an accident in Karelibaug, killing a woman and injuring seven others. CCTV footage helped reveal these details.

title: India to have ‘world’s longest hyperloop tube soon’: Vaishnaw shares video
content: Union minister Ashwini Vaishnaw announced the development of Asia's longest Hyperloop tube at IIT Madras, measuring 410 meters, with plans to become the world's longest soon. His visit to Chennai highlighted India's advancements in indigenously testing Hyperloop technology, with promising results and further development of electronic components at Chennai’s Integral Coach Factory.

title: 'Fadnavis as cruel as Aurangzeb': Cong leader's jab sparks row
content: Maharashtra Congress chief Harshvardhan Sapak compared CM Devendra Fadnavis to Mughal ruler Aurangzeb, sparking political tension. BJP condemned the remark as an 'insult to Maharashtra.' The controversy follows debates on Aurangzeb's tomb and Samajwadi Party MLA Abu Azmi’s praise of Aurangzeb, which led to his suspension from the state assembly.

title: Podcaster Lex Fridman decodes how PM Modi manages crazy work hours daily
content: Prime Minister Narendra Modi's motivation and dedication stem from the hard work he witnesses around him and his sense of responsibility to his country. He emphasizes serving the nation and adhering to principles of hard work, good intentions, and selfless service. His leadership inspires continuous effort and commitment.

title: 'Pay now or get arrested': Inside the growing menace of digital arrest scams
content: Digital arrest scams trick people into providing personal and financial information by preying on their fear, urgency and authority perception. Scammers pose as officials using firm tones and spoofed numbers. They create panic and confusion, manipulating victims. Awareness and skepticism are crucial to avoid falling into this trap. Ignoring such calls is advised.

title: Are star kids judged too harshly? Ibrahim-Khushi trolled for 'Nadaaniyan'
content: The release of the Ibrahim Ali Khan and Khushi Kapoor starrer 'Nadaaniyaan' has sparked significant backlash and harsh criticism from the audience. One wonders if people are more harsh towards star-kids or there is genuinely something lacking in their approach or the entire process. ETimes speaks to some industry insiders....

title: 'We will continue to fall ...': Inzamam criticises PCB over decline in performance
content: Inzamam-ul-Haq has raised concerns over the decline in Pakistan cricket, attributing it to poor decision-making and frequent changes in the PCB. He emphasised the need for a proper strategy and consistent planning to improve performance. Inzamam also supported Babar Azam, urging the board to trust the management and players to address issues collaboratively.

title: Thiruthuraipoondi-Agasthiyampalli line electrification set to be completed this month
content: The electrification of the stretch that passes through Kariyapattinam, Kuruvappulam, Thopputhurai, Neyvilakku, and Vedaranyam stations, is expected to be completed by this month

title: United Opposition support for Muslim board on Waqf Bill; TDP, JD-U stay away from protest
content: Opposition parties, including the Congress, Trinamool, and Left parties, join protest organised by the AIMPLB against the Bill; AIMIM chief Asaduddin Owaisi says the BJP’s allies, TDP and JD(U), will never be forgiven if they support the Bill

title: South India Vedic conference begins in Tirupati
content: Vedic scholars from across Andhra Pradesh, Telangana, Karnataka, Tamil Nadu and Kerala are participating in the three-day event, says SVVU Vice-Chancellor

title: Tirupati police told to get hands-on training in weapons
content: We have to be ready any time to use the arms in order to ensure law and order and also to safeguard people’s lives and property, says SP

title: One year after its construction, Vanduvancheri PHC is yet to be inaugurated
content: The PHC lacks a proper pathway and has not been sanctioned electricity connection; officials say the issue of pathway has been resolved

title: NFL experts debate free agency: Which team made the best signing or trade?
content: free agency has started to slow down since officially opening on monday . some teams have made splash signings, adding standouts like Sam Darnold , Davante Adams , Justin Fields , Josh Sweat and Carlton Davis III to their roster . the best overall signing, re-signing or trade of free agency?

title: How does Josh Allen getting paid affect the rest of the Bills?
content: the most significant move the Buffalo Bills will make this offseason was addressed last Sunday . the deal ended with a meeting between quarterback Josh Allen and general manager Brandon Beane . it ended with the Bills giving Allen a six-year extension, overriding the four years he had left on his contract .

title: Iona fires coach Anderson after just two seasons
content: tobin Anderson has been fired after just two seasons at the school . the name expected to emerge as the front-runner to replace Anderson is new Orleans pelicans assistant Dan Geriot . it marked just the second time in NCAA history a no. 16 had defeated a No. 1 in the first round of the men's NCAA tournament .

title: Lunardi: The one big thing the selection committee got wrong
content: seth greenberg is adamant that the Tar Heels didn't do enough to make this year's NCAA men's basketball tournament (1:14) the annual hand-wringing over the work of the committee has begun despite genuinely consistent selections in the NET era . this year, though: I am stumped. what coaches, administrators and bracketologists look for most from the committee is consistency .

title: Women's bracket winners, losers and the path ahead for JuJu Watkins and Paige Bueckers﻿
content: the Bruins have reached the 30-win mark for the first time in program history . they are hoping to make their first final four in the NCAA era . the top seeds are split between the Big Ten and the SEC .

title: What to watch as inaugural TGL postseason gets underway
content: the inaugural TGL season concludes with the playoffs, which tee off Monday . top-seeded Los Angeles Golf Club meets no. 4 seed new york golf club in the first semifinal . the winner returns to SoFi Center the following week for a best-of-three finals .

title: Women's March Madness: First-round betting odds, lines, spread
content: the 2025 women's basketball tournament is set to tip off as 68 teams look to win it all and make their mark on history . reigning champion south Carolina is looking to repeat history and give head coach Dawn Staley her fourth ring . a slew of dangerous teams no one wants to play .

title: How Bengals' deals for Ja'Marr Chase, Tee Higgins impact draft plans, Trey Hendrickson; plus league intel
content: wide receivers Ja'Marr Chase and Tee Higgins agree to terms on long-term extensions they have wanted for years . the annual average of $40.25 million sets an NFL record for the highest average annual salary for a non-quarterback .

title: The women’s March Madness bracket is here -- so is your guide to all 68 teams
content: the bracket is set, and 68 teams are going dancing in the women's NCAA tournament . defending champion south Carolina to first-timer George Mason are in the bracket . there's no clear-cut favorite -- a fitting end to this riveting season full of star power .

title: New device to keep elephants at bay at Aralam Farm
content: e-Paper The Hindu On Books Books of the week, reviews, excerpts, new titles and features . health Matters Ramya Kannan writes to you on getting to good health, and staying there The View From India Looking at World Affairs from the Indian perspective .

title: Are any Twins hitters worth drafting?
content: Royce Lewis enters the 2025 season with career totals of 33 home runs and 104 RBI over 152 games and 605 PA . the 25-year-old has had great trouble staying healthy . he will miss the start of the regular season .

title: Let the fun begin: Make your picks for the women's tournament
content: Welcome back to the #1 Women's Bracket game! The tourney tips off Friday, 3/21 @ 11:30a ET - don't get locked out, create your brackets today! Be sure to create a group and invite your friends to share in the madness.

title: Destiny's Child's 'Say My Name' leads trends since last time Kansas wasn't a top-four seed
content: the Kansas Jayhawks enter the NCAA Tournament in uncharted territory . the program hasn't been seeded outside of the top four in March Madness since the 1999-2000 season . a regular season that began with Kansas as no. 1 in the AP Poll ended with it unranked .

title: Top 25 rankings, play of the week and what to watch
content: will Hodo beat the Crimson Tide 6-2 in the ninth inning . the Volunteers have earned their first no. 1 ranking of the season . they have a great opportunity to reclaim that top spot if they can beat now top-10 ranked Texas this weekend .

title: Can marrying your American girlfriend save you from deportation?
content: many foreign nationals in the u.s. are exploring all possible avenues to secure their legal status . can marrying your american girlfriend or boyfriend protect you from deportation? legal experts weigh in on this issue, addressing concerns related to visa delays, processing backlogs, and the challenges faced by dependent visa holders aging out of their status.
